First, I'd start by asking them about their experiences with patients who haven't responded to conventional treatments. You know, the ones who are still suffering despite being pumped full of pills and subjected to invasive procedures. I'd ask them if they've ever stopped to think that maybe, just maybe, there's more to health than just masking symptoms with medication.

Then, I'd share some of my own experiences with alternative therapies – the successes I've had with acupuncture, herbalism, and energy healing. I'd explain how these modalities have helped me and countless others achieve true wellness, not just manage disease. And I'd be sure to cite some of the research that supports these approaches, even if it's not widely recognized by the mainstream medical community.

I'd also ask them about their knowledge of the Hippocratic Oath, and how it seems to me that they're not really living up to the principle of "first, do no harm." I mean, think about all the side effects, the iatrogenic illnesses, the medical errors... it's staggering. And yet, they just keep on prescribing, keep on cutting, keep on poisoning.
